quiz.title: Two-Point Equation Construction
quiz.subtitle: Unit 5 Quiz 3: Writing Equations Given Two Points
quiz.subject: Mathematics
quiz.topic: Creating Linear Equations from Two Given Points

questions.question: Write the equation of the line passing through points $(2, 3)$ and $(5, 9)$.
Find the equation of the line through $(-1, 4)$ and $(3, -2)$.
What is the equation of the line passing through $(0, -5)$ and $(4, 7)$?
Write the equation for the line through $(-3, 8)$ and $(-3, -2)$.
questions.explanation: Both points have x-coordinate -3, so this is a vertical line. Vertical lines have equation $x = \text{constant}$, so $x = -3$.

questions.question: Find the equation of the line passing through $(4, 1)$ and $(6, 1)$.
questions.explanation: Both points have y-coordinate 1, so this is a horizontal line. Horizontal lines have equation $y = \text{constant}$, so $y = 1$.

questions.question: Write the equation of the line through $(-2, -5)$ and $(1, 4)$.
What is the equation of the line through $(5, 0)$ and $(0, -10)$?
Find the equation of the line through $(\frac{1}{2}, 3)$ and $(2, -1)$.
Write the equation of the line through the origin and $(4, -6)$.
Find the equation of the line through $(-8, 3)$ and $(4, 3)$.
questions.explanation: Both points have y-coordinate 3, so this is a horizontal line. Horizontal lines have equation $y = \text{constant}$, so $y = 3$.

scoreMessages.90: Exceptional! You master two-point equation writing, including special cases (horizontal/vertical) and complex fractions.
scoreMessages.70: Strong skills! Focus on careful slope calculation with negatives and simplifying fractional equations completely.
scoreMessages.50: Good progress. Practice: 1) Slope formula $m = (y_2-y_1)/(x_2-x_1)$, 2) Using either point in point-slope form, 3) Recognizing identical x or y coordinates for vertical/horizontal lines.
scoreMessages.0: Start with calculating slope using two points. Then use point-slope form with either point: $y - y_1 = m(x - x_1)$.
